column1: Data Supplied By: National Livestock Reporting Service
Data source: National Livestock Reporting Service
Please see terms of use here: https://www.mla.com.au/general/Terms-and-conditions/data-and-information/

Numbers were down for a total yarding of 387 mainly good quality cattle. Cows again dominated the yarding with heavy slaughter cows regaining on last week while store cows gained 20c/kg. Heavy bulls eased 10c while an improved quality yarding of yearlings suitable for processors and feeder buyers gained with demand.

Yearling steers sold from 215c to 332c quality dependent while yearling heifers made 160c to 298c for light weights and 280c to 300c for the heavier weights.

Bullocks weighing over 500kg sold for 250c to 276c while grown steers weighing under 500kg made 278c to 314c /kg.

Grown heifers weighing under 540kg sold from 232c to 288c while heavier weights made from 232c to 264c/kg.  

Heavy weight cows sold from 194c to 238c while stores returned 70c for plain types up to 208c for the younger aged cows. Heavy bulls sold from 200c to 216c /kg.

Tracey Kilner--NLRS
